message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with person re-identification, which is a common task in computer vision. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel attention-based network architecture to extract global and local features, which is a common technique in computer vision. 

The paper may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category as person re-identification is often used in multimedia applications such as surveillance and video analysis. 

The paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a novel network architecture that jointly learns attention and feature extraction. 

The paper may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as person re-identification is a common task in AI applications such as robotics and autonomous vehicles. 

Finally, the paper may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as person re-identification can be seen as a retrieval task where the goal is to retrieve the correct identity of a person given a query image.
